abstract: The Class Act is dead, Medicare doesn't pay for what many elderly people really need and the cost of paying out of pocket is astonishing.
snippet: The Class Act is dead, Medicare doesn't pay for what many elderly people really need and the cost of paying out of pocket is astonishing.
lead_paragraph: This weekend brought more depressing news on the long-term care insurance front -- and continued evidence that we have our heads in the sand about these issues.

headline.main: Long-Term Care Insurance and Our Collective Denial
